page.title: 04EYEMOUTH ICE PLANT
page.content: {EYEMOUTH ICE PLANT When Granton Ice Plant which had previously supplied ice for the local fishing fleet closed down, Eyemouth decided to build a plant beside the harbour. It was built 5 years ago in 1980. Its purpose is to supply the boats with ice to keep catches fresh at sea. The ice is made by running water over a refridgerator plate that freezes almost instantly. When it cracks and falls it is broken up by a large blade. Every 3 and 3 quarter minutes 2 and a half hundred weight of ice is produced. This is transported down a tube into a lorry and on to the boats. Every day 50 tonnes of ice is produced at the plant in the refridgerator, the temperature is 16'C. The water used is fresh.
